p: Based on the constructed a maximum likelihood phylogenetic tree a total of 109 clusters and pairs containing 321 (33.2%) sequences were found, including 36 clusters of ≥3 individuals incorporating 165 (17.1%) sequences ( S1 Fig). There were ten clusters of ≥5 sequences (n = 81, 8.4%), including two larger ones comprising 13 and 20 patients. All these clusters contained only individuals infected by the MSM route (shaded in grey at S1 Fig). Frequency of transmission pairs and clusters notably increased over time: from 26.92% in 2009 to 50.6% in 2014 [OR: 1.18 (95%CI: 1.06–1.31), p = 0.0026; slope for the frequency increase 2.8%/year]. This trend was similar when sequence pairs were excluded from the clustering analyses (increase from 9.62% in 2009 to 25.3% in 2014 [OR: 1.21 (95%CI: 1.06–1.38), p = 0.004; slope for the frequency increase 2.2%/year] ( Fig 1).
